```{r}
#| label: setup
#| message: false
library(tidyverse)
library(primer.data)
library(tidymodels)
library(gtsummary)
library(equatiomatic)
```

```{r}
set.seed(10)

x <- nhanes |> 
  filter(age >= 18) |> 
  select(height, sex) |> 
  drop_na() |> 
  slice_sample(n = 50, by = sex)
```

Men and women have different average heights. We analyze this using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey. Because this survey is voluntary, there may be a potential bias or uncertainty.  We model height as a linear function of sex.

```{r}
#| label: model 
#| cache: true
fit_height <- linear_reg(engine = "lm") |>
  fit(height ~ sex, data = x)
```

```{r}
#| label: math
extract_eq(fit_height, 
           intercept = "beta", 
           use_coefs = TRUE)
```


```{r}
#| label: table
tbl_regression(fit_height)
```
